Nerangs.ab: barsom wist ud ēk tāg ud frāgām dō tāg barsom bastan ud parāhōm kardan ud sāzišn hamāg frāz nihādan ud ān kas kē zōtīh kāmēd kardan aṣ̌əm vōhū (Y0.Ext2) ēk guftan ud dast pad pādyāb kardan

The barsom (consists of) 21 twigs and 2 frāgām. He should tie the barsom, prepare the parāhōm and dispose all implements. The one who wants to act as zōt should recite one aṣ̌əm vōhū (Y0.Ext2) wash his hands with pādyāb.

barsom wist ud ēk ud frāgām dō tāg barsom bastan parāhōm kardan sāzišn hamāg frāz nihādan ud ān kas ka zōtīh kāmēd kardan xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā (Y0.Ext1) aṣ̌əm vohū ēk (Y0.Ext2) yaθā ahū vairiiō. (Y0.Ext.3) haft guftan xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ (Y0.Ext4) aṣ̌əm vohū ēk (Y0.Ext5) nəmasə.tē ātarš mazdā̊ ahurahe hudā̊ mazišta yazata (Y0.Ext8) xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ (Y0.Ext9).

"The barsom consists of 21 twigs and the frāgām are two. He should tie the barsom, prepare the parāhōm and dispose all the implements. The one who wants to play the role of the zōt should recite xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā (Y0.Ext1) and one aṣ̌əm vohū (Y0.Ext2), seven yaθā ahū vairiiō (Y0.Ext3) and then xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ (Y0.Ext4), one aṣ̌əm vohū (Y0.Ext5) nəmasə.tē ātarš mazdā̊ ahurahe. hudā̊ mazišta yazata (Y0.Ext8) (and) xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ (Y0.Ext9)".

ka ādurgāh kāmēd šustan naxost dast pad pādyāb bē kunišn u-š ātaxš ud barsom bē nigerišn u-š az nōg dast pad pādyāb abāz kunišn u-š xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ tarōidite (Y0.Ext1) tā fərašaōtəməm bē gōwišn u-š az nōg dast pad pādyāb abāz kunišn ud ašemwohū sē ... rōz ī dudīgar ka yašt ī srōš kunēd pēš az ādurgāh suštan yatāhūwairyō panǰ bē gōwišn u-š ādurgāh šustan ... rōz ī sidīgar pēš az ādurgāh šustan yaθā ahū vairiiō (Y0.Ext3) dō ...

When he wants to clean the ādurgāh first, he has to made his hands clean with pādyāb and to look at the fire and the barsom He has to make anew his hands clean. He has to recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ tarōidite (Y0.Ext1) until fərašaōtəməm He has to make anew his hands clean with pādyāb (He has to continue with) three Ašemwohū. ... The second day, when he performs the Yašt for Srōš, before cleaning the ādurgāh, he has to recite five Yatāhuwairyō. He should clean the ādurgāh ... The third day, before cleaning the ādurgāh, (he should recite) two yaθā ahū vairiiō (Y0.Ext3)

ka ādurgāh kāmēd šustan naxost dast pad pādyāb abāz kunišn u-š xšnaōθra ahurahe mazdā̊ taraōi.diti (Y0.Ext1) tā staōmi aṣ̌əm bē gōwišn u-š nōg dast pad pādyāb abāz kunišn aṣ̌əm vohū (Y0.Ext2) sē ... rōz ī dudīgar ka yašt ī srōš kunēd pēš az ādurgāh suštan yatāhūwairyō panǰ bē gōwišn u-š ādurgāh šustan ... rōz ī sidīgar pēš az ādurgāh šustan yaθā ahū vairiiō (Y0.Ext3) dō bē gōwišn

When he wants to clean the ādurgāh, first, he has to make his hands clean with pādyāb. He has to recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ taraōi.dīti (Y0.Ext1) until staōmi aṣ̌əm He has to make anew his hands clean with pādyāb (He has to continue with) three Ašemwohū. ... The second day, when he performs the Yašt for Srōš, before cleaning the ādurgāh, he has to recite five Yatāhuwairyō. He should clean the ādurgāh ... The third day, before cleaning the ādurgāh, (he should recite) two yaθā ahū vairiiō (Y0.Ext3)
See as well Y0.Ext3 for further nērang

Quotations.ab: az bunīh ēn and tis ōh abāyēd barsomdān wistarišn any kār nē dānēm abārīg pad gāh ī xwēš rasēd ā šāyēd dādweh guft hād ka parahōm kard andar ān pad hān 4 ẏaθā ahū vairiiō pādyāb ān gyāg abāyēd dādweh guft ay be nigērišn

"From the beginning, the following things are necessary: the barsom stands should be put in place; I don't know of any other action. If the other things come at the proper time it is permissible. Dādweh said: "When the parāhōm is prepared, during those four Ahuna Vairiia the pādyāb must be in place." Dādweh said: "One should gaze at it."

ab.ab: "... then the priest who has performed the Paragnā, he remains seated on the stone seat keeping his hand on the bundle. After that, the priest who is about to become the chief priest, he standing in the pāvī outside of the pāvī of the table of the ritual precinct, reciting one Aṣ̌ǝm Vohū, coming into the pāvī of the table, he stands near the water container containing the pure implements."
